ques1.ques: 1. Which SQL function is used to count the number of rows in a SQL query?

ques2.ques: 2. Which SQL keyword is used to retrieve a maximum value?

ques3.ques: 3.  Which of the following SQL clauses is used to DELETE tuples from a database table?

ques3.ques: 8. If you don’t specify ASC or DESC after a SQL ORDER BY clause, the following is used by default ______________

ques4.ques: 9. Which of the following statement is true?
ques4.optoin1: DELETE does not free the space containing the table and TRUNCATE free the space containing the table
ques4.optoin2: Both DELETE and TRUNCATE free the space containing the table
ques4.optoin3: Both DELETE and TRUNCATE does not free the space containing the table
ques4.optoin4: DELETE free the space containing the table and TRUNCATE does not free the space containing the table

ques5.ques: 10. Which clause is used to combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them.

ques1.ques: 11. What is the purpose of the SQL AS clause?
ques1.optoin1: The AS SQL clause is used to change the name of a column in the result set or to assign a name to a derived column
ques1.optoin2: The AS clause is used with the JOIN clause only
ques1.optoin3: The AS clause defines a search condition

ques2.ques: 12. Which is/are correct statements about primary key of a table?
ques2.optoin1: Primary keys can contain NULL values
ques2.optoin2: Primary keys cannot contain NULL values.
ques2.optoin3: A table can have only one primary key with single or multiple fields
ques2.optoin4: A table can have multiple primary keys with single or multiple fields

ques1.ques: 16. Wrong statement about UPDATE keyword is
ques1.optoin1: If WHERE clause in missing in statement the all records will be updated.
ques1.optoin2: Only one record can be updated at a time using WHERE clause
ques1.optoin3: Multiple records can be updated at a time using WHERE clause

ques2.ques: 17. Wrong statement about ORDER BY keyword is
ques2.optoin1: Used to sort the result-set in ascending or descending order
ques2.optoin2: The ORDER BY keyword sorts the records in ascending order by default.
ques2.optoin3: To sort the records in ascending order, use the ASC keyword.
ques2.optoin4: To sort the records in descending order, use the DECENDING keyword.

ques3.ques: 18. Correct syntax query syntax to drop a column from a table is
ques3.optoin3: ALTER TABLE table_name DROP COLUMN column_name

ques4.ques: 19. If you want to allow age of a person > 18 in the column Age of table Person, then which constraint will be applied to AGE column.

ques5.ques: 20. In a table, a column contains duplicate value, if you want to list all different value only, then which SQL clause is used?

ques1.ques: 21. To give a temporary name to a table, or a column in a table for more readability, what is used?

ques2.ques: 22. SELECT CustomerName, Address + ‘, ‘ + City + ‘, ‘ + Country AS Address       FROM Customers;
ques2.optoin1: Alias named Address column will be created and under this Address, City and Country will be printed as combined statement.
ques2.optoin2: Alias named Address will be created for Country columns
ques2.optoin3: Alias named Address column will be created and under this all CustomerName, address, city and country will be printed as combined statement
